---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: please mark as `awaiting-review` if it's ready for review

@fpvandoorn Of course it is **not** ready. The proofs are still far too verbose.

I'm now trying to prove `card_edgeFinset_turanGraph_add` which gives the relation between edge counts of Tur√°n graphs **without** actually going through the 100-line proof `card_edgeFinset_turanGraph` of the absolute number of edges in the graph. But the proof terms are so complicated that I can't prove them.

### PR summary [ace1d7b927](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9317/commits/ace1d7b927ac965f06a392f2f6b94082530e0261)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ IsTuranMaximal.iso`
`+ isTuranMaximal_iff_nonempty_iso_turanGraph`
`+ isTuranMaximal_of_iso`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>
@kmill I have implemented your suggestion from https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11990#discussion_r1649772433.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9681824420/job/26713316363)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9681824420/job/26713316955)
Minor comment. Apart from that: LGTM

Could you please generalize this to say that if `G1 ‚âÉg G2` then `G1.IsTuranMaximal r` iff `G2.IsTuranMaximal r`?

Most of this proof would then turn into a proof of `isTuranMaximal_turanGraph`.
I've added the generalisation as `IsTuranMaximal.iso` ‚Äì it is easier and more readable to prove the iff statement from the original theorem than to prove the iff statement directly.
